description: North India has produced one of the best-known classical musics of the non-Western world. Developed in the unique cultural milieu of Hindu and Muslim North India, its sounds have influenced jazz, pop and classical composers and have drawn listeners from all over the world. This course introduces students to the sounds, poetry, historical contexts, and social meanings of this music. We also explore the various folk, devotional, and popular musics of the region, including ghazal, qawwali, film music, and bhangra. Readings are supplemented by audio-visual material and live performances. The course has no prerequisites.
name: MUSICAL CULTURE N. INDIA
